column4: could anyone do me a favor? i need to know if a site is having problems with the java applet or if it's just me. https://www2.bancobrasil.com.br/aapf/login.jsp?aapf.IDH=sim  --> does the java applet load and show some numbers??
people don't understand our questions =/
sorry
just want to make sure someone else can load that site, before i start tracking down the problem source
flash does have sound
is there an easy way to install flash on feisty 64bit? i mean, under gutsy, it's available automatically, offered by the plugin manager.. what about feisty?
https://help.ubuntu.com/community/AMD64/FirefoxAndPlugins
eh... you could just wait 10 days for gutsy

i've tried it already. i gave up on gutsy this afternoon, after not being able to use openoffice, having to kill nautilus some few times because it was frozen. and even on gutsy, i couldn't get java to work at all
I said wait 10 days for the release
lots of bug fixes yet to go in
oh sorry, it probably will be more stable by then, but i really doubt java will be functional.. and i need it for my homebanking access
why wouldn't it be? is it a bug, and if so have you reported it if it hasn't been already?
i'm using virtualbox, with an xp install just to access my bank.. that's ridiculous.. after 4 years without windows, i have to use it again
i didn't have problems with java when i was using 32bit feisty.. the problem is with 64bit
so I have to ask, do you have a real reason to run 64-bit?
3d rendering... or else i would be using 32bit, not much of a difference at all
and jrib, LOVE YA BOTH =P got java + flash working. and finally i know what was done to the system.. didn't have to run any obscure script to get it done
system wide or just your user? what directory may I ask?
system wide. /opt/kde3/bin
you can do what nickrud said but in /etc/profile for all users
alright, better yet =)
